ygData.msgSnippet: My favorite non-cheat team of all time has been a solo Thief. Once you get to a level where your mana recharges fast enough, you just stay cloaked, and you can

My favorite non-cheat team of all time has been a solo Thief. Once you
get to a level where your mana recharges fast enough, you just stay
cloaked, and you can easily beat the normal campaign by yourself. To do
it quick enough without cheating, though, you have to slime-farm
(running in circles around slimes, keeping them confused until they
multiply, and then bombing a few of them to death, then repeat for a
long time). I havn't tried a solo thief on any custom levels, though.

For two-player mode, my favorite team is a druid and a thief. My friend
would be the druid and build us a base, then I'd do hit-and-run missions
with cloak and he'd go around planting trees on top of enemies (most
powerful meelee attack in the game, I believe, even if its just a bug).
Good times...

On Sun, 2003-09-28 at 23:22, Patrick Wong wrote:
> --- Daniel Paul Hightower <alternate_dph@...>
> wrote:
> > What's everybody's favorite teams? I'm adding a
> > condition: no teams 
> > with archmages (since you can easily defeat 99% of
> > scenarios just by 
> > summoning enough fire elementals) or mages (since
> > you can easily 
> > defeat 99% of scenarios just by freezing time and
> > then attacking).
> 
> Archers and Thieves. Archers for using Explosive Bolt,
> Thieves for creating a line of traps you can't pass so
> that you don't dare engage in melee combat.
> 
> When I try to do solo games (pretty hard), I tend
> towards Thieves, because then I can hurt the enemy
> while running away at the same time.
>
